articleContentTranslated: Ex-Ã–FB team boss Otto Baric has passed away The former Austrian soccer team boss Otto Baric has died at the age of 87. The Croatian Football Association announced this on Sunday.

According to the daily â€œVecernji Listâ€, the legendary coach was infected with the corona virus and died as a result of the disease. U Zagrebu je u 88. godini preminuo Otto BariÄ‡, jedan od najuspjeÅ¡nijih hrvatskih nogometnih trenera svih vremena i bivÅ¡i izbornik Vatrenih.
Hrvatski nogometni savez izraÅ¾ava duboku suÄ‡ut njegovoj obitelji zbog ovog nenadoknadivog gubitka.

PoÄivao u miru. ğŸ“¸ Drago Sopta pic.twitter.com/S9OC2Kr109â€” HNS (@HNS_CFF) December 13, 2020 Baric was trainer for Innsbruck, LASK, Rapid, Sturm, Austria Salzburg and team manager of the national team.
He celebrated his greatest successes with Rapid and Salzburg. He led Rapid to the final of the European Cup Winners' Cup in 1985 and Austria Salzburg to the final of the UEFA Cup in 1994.
